title: Future in trait_alias causes internal compiler error ?

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(trait_alias)] use futures::Future; trait F> = Fn() -> Fut; fn f(a: dyn F) {} fn main() {} ``` ### Meta - `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.0-nightly (1286ee23e 2022-11-05) binary: rustc commit-hash: 1286ee23e4e2dec8c1696d3d76c6b26d97bbcf82 commit-date: 2022-11-05 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.67.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.4 ``` - Moving `>` to where-clause (e.g. `where Fut: Future`) doesn't change the result - Some part of code analyzing of rust-analyzer seems to stop at `dyn F`. For example, when we add some "*plausible*" arguments like `b: F, c: Fn` after `a: dyn F`, rust-analyzer doesn't report any mistakes. - When replacing `Future` with non-Future trait like `ToString`, everything get fine: - rust-analyzer reports "the size for values of type `(dyn Fn() -> Fut + 'static)` cannot be known at compilation time" caused by rustc - and adding `&` to `dyn F` makes it compilable ### Error output `cargo build`: ``` Compiling x v0.1.0 (/Users/kanarus/Projects/experiment-of-cargo) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` left: `Fut`, right: `FreshTy(0)`', compiler/rustc_hir_analysis/src/astconv/mod.rs:1510:17 stack backtrace: 0: 0x104a37d00 -
